titles: An elegie on the never to be forgotten Sir Thomas Armstrong Knight; executed for conspiring the death of His most sacred Majesty, and royal brother, June 20. 1684. With some satyrical reflections on the whole faction.
publisher: Printed for William Bateman, in the Old Change.,
notes: Verse: "Stand forth ye damn'd deluding priests of Baal ..."
Reproduction of original in the British Library.
keywords: Armstrong, Thomas, --  Sir, 1624?-1684 --  Poetry --  Early works to 1800.
Rye House Plot, 1683 --  Poetry --  Early works to 1800.
